{{EngvarB|date=August 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Claudio Gomes | image = | caption = | fullname = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|2000|7|23}} | birth_place = [[Argenteuil]], France | height = 1.80 m<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-claudio-gomes-wiki-14940663|title=Who is Claudio Gomes? French teenager profiled after Manchester City transfer|first=Liam|last=Corless|date=5 August 2018|publisher=}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|Defensive midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | clubnumber = 81 | youthyears1 = 2006–2010 | youthclubs1 = ASC Val d'Argenteuil | youthyears2 = 2010–2011 | youthclubs2 = RFC Argenteuil | youthyears3 = 2011–2013 | youthclubs3 = [[Évreux FC 27|Évreux]] | youthyears4 = 2013–2018 | youthclubs4 = [[Paris Saint-Germain Academy|Paris Saint-Germain]] | years1 = 2017–2018 | clubs1 = [[Paris Saint-Germain Academy|Paris Saint-Germain B]] | caps1 = 1 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2018– | clubs2 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps2 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam1 = [[France national under-16 football team|France U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 13 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam2 = [[France national under-17 football team|France U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 16 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2017 | nationalteam3 = [[France national under-18 football team|France U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 7 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | nationalyears4 = 2018– | nationalteam4 = [[France national under-19 football team|France U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 8 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | pcupdate = 5 August 2018 | ntupdate = 20 November 2018 }} '''Claudio Gomes''' (born 23 July 2000) is a French [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]] for English club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[France national under-18 football team|France national under-18 team]]. Prior to signing for Manchester City in 2018, he represented [[Paris Saint-Germain Academy|Paris Saint-Germain B]], having played youth football with that club and a number of other French teams.
==Club career== Born in [[Argenteuil]], [[Val-d'Oise]] on 23 July 2000, Gomes played as a youth for ASC Val d'Argenteuil and RFC Argenteuil, two teams in his hometown, before joining [[Évreux FC 27|Évreux]] in 2011 and [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] two years later.<ref name=six>{{cite news |last1=Marie |first1=Réginald |title=Six choses à savoir sur le capitaine des Bleuets qui évolue au Paris Saint-Germain|trans-title=Six things to know about the ''Bluets'' captain who is growing at Paris Saint-Germain |url=https://www.lepopulaire.fr/limoges/sports/football/2017/09/01/six-choses-a-savoir-sur-le-capitaine-des-bleuets-qui-evolue-au-paris-saint-germain_12533517.html |accessdate=5 August 2018 |work=Le Populaire du Centre |date=1 September 2017 |language=French}}</ref>
Gomes made his senior debut for PSG's [[Reserve team|reserves]] on 18 November 2017, his one appearance for the club. He came on as a 79th-minute substitute for [[Abdallah Yaisien]] in a 2–1 home loss to [[AS Yzeure|Yzeure]] in the [[Championnat National 2]] ([[French football league system|fourth tier]]).<ref>{{cite news |last1=Gineste |first1=Franck |title=Football, National 2 : première défaite à domicile pour la réserve du PSG contre Yzeure (1–2) |trans-title=Football, National 2: first home defeat for PSG reserves against Yzeure (1–2)|url=http://www.leparisien.fr/sports/ile-de-france/football-national-2-premiere-defaite-a-domicile-pour-la-reserve-du-psg-contre-yzeure-1-2-18-11-2017-7400697.php |accessdate=5 August 2018 |work=Le Parisien |date=17 November 2017 |language=French}}</ref>
On 25 July 2018, Gomes signed with [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first%20team/first%20team%20news/2018/july/man%20city%20sign%20claudio%20gomes|title=City Signs Claudio Gomes|publisher=Manchester City F.C.}}</ref> He had trained with the club since the expiry of his PSG contract in June, and been on their pre-season tour of the United States, but they chose to wait for him to turn 18 before signing him.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Corless |first1=Liam |title=Who is Claudio Gomes? French teenager profiled after Manchester City transfer |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-claudio-gomes-wiki-14940663 |accessdate=5 August 2018 |work=Manchester Evening News |date=5 August 2017}}</ref> He made his professional debut on 5 August in a 2–0 win over [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in the [[2018 FA Community Shield]] at [[Wembley Stadium]], coming on in added time for [[John Stones]].<ref name=shield>{{cite news |last1=Bevan |first1=Chris |title=Chelsea 0–2 Manchester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44995783 |accessdate=5 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 August 2018}}</ref> He was in the game for one second before the final whistle blew and his team won the trophy.<ref>{{cite news |title=Is this the shortest debut in football history? |url=https://au.sports.yahoo.com/shortest-debut-football-history-031754022.html |accessdate=8 August 2018 |publisher=Yahoo! |date=7 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Gomes is a youth international for France, having captained the [[France national under-17 football team|France U17]]s at the [[2017 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fff.fr/articles/equipes-de-france-1/details-articles/175692-la-liste-de-lionel-rouxel|title=Les dix-huit joueurs pour l'Euro 2017|trans-title=The eighteen players for Euro 2017|publisher=FFF|language=French}}</ref> and the [[2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/La-france-au-mondial-u17-avec-geubbels-et-isidor/836103#xtor=RSS-1/|title=La France au Mondial U17 avec Geubbels et Isidor|trans-title=France at the I17 World Cup with Geubbels and Isidor|first=|last=|work=L'Équipe|language=French}}</ref> He was named in the team of the tournament at the former in Croatia, in which the French reached the quarter-finals.<ref name=team/> In France's opening match at the latter tournament in India, he scored in a 7–1 win over [[New Caledonia national under-17 football team|New Caledonia]].<ref>{{cite news |title=France prove too strong for New CaledoniaFrance prove too strong for New Caledonia |url=https://www.fifa.com/u17worldcup/matches/round=275931/match=300394731/match-report.html |accessdate=5 August 2018 |publisher=FIFA |date=8 October 2017}}</ref> In August 2018, he was called up for the first time to the [[France national under-19 football team|under-19 team]] for friendlies against [[Slovenia national under-19 football team|Slovenia]], [[Croatia national under-19 football team|Croatia]] and India.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Chochois |first1=Alexandre |title=France U19 : La liste pour les trois amicaux|trans-title=France U19: The list for the three friendlies|url=http://www.foot-national.com/foot-france-u19-la-liste-pour-les-trois-amicaux-110790.html |accessdate=8 September 2018 |publisher=Foot National |date=28 August 2018 |language=French}}</ref>
==Style of play== Gomes is nicknamed "[[N'Golo Kanté]]" by his teammates, who liken him to the French international midfielder for his efforts in recovering the ball.<ref name=six/>
==Personal life== Gomes is the son of Bissau-Guinean footballer Amarildo Gomes, who was developing at [[AS Beauvais Oise|Beauvais]] and [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]] before retiring through a knee injury.<ref name=six/><ref name=bleu>{{cite web|url=http://www.leparisien.fr/informations/claudio-gomes-se-revele-deja-en-bleu-28-05-2016-5835669.php|title=Claudio Gomes se révèle déjà en bleu|trans-title=Claudio Gomes revealing himself already in blue|work=Le Parisien|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.footballdatabase.eu/es/jugador/detalles/122565-amarildo-gomes|title=Amarildo Gomes - Jubilado|publisher=Football Database}}</ref> As of 2017, his two younger brothers were playing for [[Le Havre AC|Le Havre]] and Évreux.<ref name=six/> A 2016 profile of Gomes by ''[[Le Parisien]]'' noted his passion for history, particularly the [[French Revolution]].<ref name=bleu/>
==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 1 November 2018}}
